Name.label: Susceptibility to viral and mycobacterial infections
Genetic susceptibility to infections due to particular pathogens

TextSection.Contents: Susceptibility to viral and mycobacterial infections is a rare, genetic, primary immunodeficiency due to a defect in innate immunity disorder characterized by impaired intracellular signaling from both type I and type II interferons, leading to early-onset, severe, life-threatening intracellular bacterial (typically mycobacteria) and viral (mainly herpes viruses) infections.

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))
signal transducer and activator of transcription 1
